topics.content: Science is the study of the natural world through observation and experiments.
Science helps us understand nature, develop technology, and improve daily life.

chapters.chapter: Exploring Substances: Acidic, Basic, and Neutral

topics.content: Acids are substances that taste sour and turn blue litmus red.
Bases are substances that feel soapy and turn red litmus blue.
Neutral substances do not change the color of litmus paper.
Indicators are substances used to test whether a material is acidic or basic.
An electric circuit is a complete path through which electric current flows.
A circuit includes a cell, wires, switch, and an electric device.
Conductors allow electricity to pass through them, while insulators do not.

chapters.chapter: The World of Metals and Non-metals

topics.content: Metals are substances that are shiny, hard, and good conductors of heat and electricity.
Non-metals are substances that are dull and poor conductors of heat and electricity.
Metals and non-metals are used in daily life for making tools, wires, and household items.

chapters.chapter: Changes Around Us: Physical and Chemical

topics.content: A physical change changes the shape or state of a substance without forming a new substance.
A chemical change results in the formation of a new substance.
Reversible changes can be undone, while irreversible changes cannot.

chapters.chapter: Adolescence: A Stage of Growth and Change

topics.content: Adolescence is the stage of life when a child grows into an adult.
Adolescence brings physical changes such as increase in height and body development.
Eating healthy food and exercising help maintain good health during adolescence.
Heat is a form of energy that flows from a hotter object to a colder object.
Conduction is the transfer of heat through direct contact.
Convection is the transfer of heat through liquids and gases.
Radiation is the transfer of heat without any medium.
Time is measured using clocks and standard units like seconds and minutes.
Motion is the change in position of an object with time.
Motion can be linear, circular, or periodic.
Animals obtain nutrition by consuming plants or other animals.
Respiration is the process of releasing energy from food.
Excretion is the removal of waste materials from the body.
Photosynthesis is the process by which plants make food using sunlight.
Plants respire to release energy from food.
Transpiration is the loss of water from plant leaves.
Light is a form of energy that enables us to see objects.
A shadow is formed when light is blocked by an opaque object.
Reflection is the bouncing back of light from a surface.
Earth is the planet that supports life and revolves around the Sun.
The Moon is Earth's natural satellite.
The Sun is a star that provides heat and light to the Earth.
